headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: compare_time_window
parameters.description: Time window for comparison (in days). Enum: 7 (default), 14 , 30 , 60

parameters.name: dimensions
parameters.description: List of dimensions to compare. 1-4 dimensions are allowed. Enum: LOCATION , AD_CATEGORY , EXTERNAL_ACTION , PLACEMENT

parameters.name: metrics_fields
parameters.description: Metrics that you want to get. By default, all metrics will be returned. See the Supported metrics section for supported metrics.

parameters.name: filtering
parameters.description: Filtering conditions. You must specify one and only one out of the three conditions allowed

parameters.name: ad_ids
parameters.description: IDs of the ads that you want to get benchmark results for

parameters.name: adgroup_ids
parameters.description: IDs of the ad groups that you want to get benchmark results for

parameters.name: campaign_ids
parameters.description: IDs of the campaigns that you want to get benchmark results for

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Field to sort by. By default, results will be sorted by CREATE_TIME

parameters.name: sort_type
parameters.description: Sorting type. Enum: ASC (starting from the one that was created earliest), DES (starting from the one that was created latest)

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of error codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

fields.name: compare_date
fields.description: Date when the comparison is performed

fields.name: list
fields.description: List of results. Note : If an ad accumulates fewer than 1,000 impressions within the comparison window ( compare_time_window ), the benchmark metric data will be empty.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Information about the subject to get benchmark data for

fields.name: ad_category
fields.description: Level 2 interest category ID. For the list of categories, see Get interest categories . To determine the corresponding names for gaming-related interest category IDs, see Interest category .

fields.name: external_action
fields.description: External action (conversion event) for the ad

fields.name: metric_name
fields.description: The returned metrics, determined by the setting via metrics_fields in the request. After the metric name, you can see a number with one decimal place, in the value range of [0.0,1.0]. The number indicates how the current metric of the ad performs compared with other ads in terms of dimensions ( dimensions ) you specify in the request. For instance, "video_watched_6s": 0.6 means the "video_watched_6s" metric data of the ad outperforms about 60% of all ads in terms of specified dimensions. See the Supported metrics section for the supported metrics.
